text: Stumbled across this studio and thought they had a lot of fun projects: <http://skrekkogle.com>

attachments.text: Skrekkøgle is a tiny product and digital design studio in Oslo, Norway.

text:
got a article here about "The ethics of good design: A principle for the connected age"

 I like the add to Dieter Rams’ 10 commandments of good design: article 11. Good design is ethical. The product places the user’s interest at the center of its purpose. Any effort to influence the user’s agency or behavior is in the spirit of their own positive wellbeing, and the wellbeing of those around them.

<https://medium.com/swlh/dieter-rams-ten-principles-for-good-design-the-1st-amendment-4e73111a18e4#.gjnnmoobg>

attachments.title: The ethics of good design: A principle for the connected age – The Startup
attachments.text: One product designer’s amendment to Dieter Rams’ 10 Principles for Good Design
attachments.fallback: Medium: The ethics of good design: A principle for the connected age – The Startup

text: I really like this direction this article is going, but I think the ethical calculus involved is even more complex than the author acknowledges
also the final like - As a user, did what I just do feel 100% like my choice?” - raises some really interesting practical and philosophical lines of questioning
